methods.name: onChange
methods.description: Executed when a user edits (i.e. add or remove) the textarea's value Strips excessive spacing (no more than one space between words is allowed) A necessary (and low-cost) compromise to make the css voodoo in <StyledMentionText /> work

tags.name: event
tags.value: onChange emits updated textarea value to parent context via onChange action binding

tags.name: event
tags.value: getMentionOptions emits current mention to parent context via getMentionOptions action

params.name: newValue
params.description: The new, raw text value from textarea element

methods.name: doMention
methods.description: Executed when a user selects a mention result in the mention options dropdown Completes the mention by adding it to the textarea text and pushing it to the array tracking added mentions Refocuses textarea element

tags.name: event
tags.value: this.args.onChange emits updated textarea text value to parent context

params.name: mentionValue
params.description: Complete mention value (e.g. a user's full username)

methods.name: addMentionToText
methods.description: Helper function to add a completed mention to a given text value

returns.description: text with the new mention added

params.name: text
params.description: Text to add the mention to (in this case, the current value of the textarea element)

params.name: incompleteMention
params.description: The current, incomplete mention value (e.g. a user's incomplete username, andrew.b)

params.name: mentionValue
params.description: Complete mention value (e.g. a user's full username, andrew.ball)

methods.name: keyDown
methods.description: Binds to the textarea's key down event and closes the mention options dropdown this action delegates various key down events like close with escape, and navigating to/selecting a mention when the user mentions via enter and arrow keys

params.name: event
params.description: The key down event. Used to check the key property

methods.name: getMentions
methods.description: Gets all mentions in a given string matching the mentionPattern

returns.description: all mentions in a given string of text

methods.name: findCurrentMention
methods.description: Finds the mention the user is currently adding based on the position of the user's cursor inside the textarea

methods.name: getSpecificMentionRegex
methods.description: Creates a regular expression that can be used to match text for a specific mention

returns.description: regular expression to match a mention option's full display value

params.name: mentionValue
params.description: The full display value for a mention option (e.g. a user's username)

accessors.name: value
accessors.description: The textarea element's raw text value

accessors.name: options
accessors.description: The textarea element's raw text value

accessors.name: specialCharacter
accessors.description: Character used to trigger a mention

accessors.name: mentionPattern
accessors.description: Regular expression pattern used to match text for mentions

accessors.name: defaultRegex
accessors.description: Regular expression pattern used to match text for mentions

accessors.name: showHint
accessors.description: Used to control visibility of a hint directly underneath textarea element. The hint instructs users how to mention

accessors.name: isMentioning
accessors.description: Check if we have (or don't have) a mention that is currently being added

accessors.name: currentMention
accessors.description: Getter function to get the mention currently being added

methods.name: onMentionClick
methods.description: Optionally override the onclick behavior when a mention is clicked

tags.name: event
tags.value: onMentionClick emits clicked mention to consuming app to handle

params.name: mention
params.description: The new, raw text value from textarea element

accessors.name: existingMentions
accessors.description: List of mentions that have already been added. If the user doesn't pass, any text matching the provided mention pattern will be styled as a mention

accessors.name: mentionPattern
accessors.description: Regular expression pattern used to match text for mentions

accessors.name: readonly
accessors.description: Render standalone mention text in readonly mode

accessors.name: textAreaElement
accessors.description: Reference to the textarea DOM element. Not relevant in readonly mode

template:docs/caveats.title: Caveats
template:docs/caveats.text: Caveats There are a few things to keep in mind before you install the addon and while you're developing: As its name implies, Mentionable Paper Input is dependent on the ember-paper library and is required to use MPI. For now, the mentions dropdown list only supports a maximum of 6 visible mentions. Scrolling is disabled on the dropdown element as well. Depending on text length and combination of specific characters the user enters, mention styling on certain mobile devices and browsers can look "off" or inconsistent at times. This issue is rare but can hurt the overall user experience. You can conditionally apply the disableStyling flag at mobile screen sizes as a way to bypass the issue. We will continue to work to improve the developer and user experience of the addon and intend to address these and other issues in future versions. We are always accepting pull-requests for features, enhancements, and/or bug fixes.

template:docs/demo.text: Me Pro Tip You can also use the <StyledMentionText> component to render mentions in readonly mode For now, the "on mention click" behavior is limited to overriding the href via @hrefOverride. In future versions the on mention click override behavior will be more flexible.

template:docs/index.title: Overview
template:docs/index.text: Overview Mentionable Paper Input is an implementation of ember-paper's textarea input that allows users to add "mentions" to input text - think @ing someone on Twitter or Instagram. There are other mention libraries in the Ember ecosystem, but none provide the same sleek styling you'd see on popular social networking sites. And understandably so - browsers prevent direct styling of <input> and <textarea> values, making it difficult to implement custom mention styling on input text. However with a little CSS and Javascript sleight of hand, we were able to create a styled and customizable mentionable input addon. Its use isn't strictly limited to mentions either. Mentionable Paper Input can be used to add hashtags, check-in at a location, highlight keywords in text, and so on. The component is extremely flexible and can support a number of use cases beyond basic mentioning.

template:docs/install.title: Installation
template:docs/install.text: Installation NPM npm install mentionable-paper-input Yarn yarn add mentionable-paper-input
